entry.title: bondiola sandwich (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the bondiola sandwich (example pictured) is a popular street food in Argentina?

entry.title: al-Fa'iz bi-Nasr Allah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Fatimid boy caliph al-Fa'iz bi-Nasr Allah was raised to the throne by the vizier, who had killed his father and uncles?

entry.title: Frelinghuysen University (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that of more than 300 schools offering evening classes in the District of Columbia in 1907, only Frelinghuysen University admitted Black students?

entry.title: Kloe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kloe was a headliner at King Tut's Wah Wah Hut in 2014, despite not being old enough to attend most shows there?

entry.title: time viewers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that science fiction authors who want to avoid the paradoxes associated with time travel may instead write about time viewers?

entry.title: their own railroad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that three decades after chasing away surveyors for a previous railroad with guns, residents of Wickford, Rhode Island, built their own railroad?

entry.title: Charles Norris-Newman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Charles Norris-Newman was a war correspondent, a corrupt British colonial official and a Russian intelligence officer?

entry.title: TV-16 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a media columnist in Columbus, Georgia, opined: "If TV-16 was a horse, it would have been shot long ago"?
